Inherited
Displays tooltip text when the mouse moves over the element.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: activeSectionName
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: The activeSectionName changes the default expanded section. The first section in the accordion is expanded by default.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: allowMultipleSectionsOpen
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: If true, all sections will be closed by default and the accordion will allow multiple sections open at a time.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: onsectiontoggle
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Action fired when the open sections change, it contains all open sections.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: title
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION:

Displays tooltip text when the mouse moves over the element.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: name
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: The unique section name to use with the activeSectionName attribute in the lightning:accordion component.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: label
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: The text that displays as the title of the section.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: actions
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Enables a custom menu implementation. Actions are displayed to the right of the section title.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: body
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION:

The body of the component. In markup, this is everything in the body of the tag.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION:

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: title
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION:
Inherited
Displays tooltip text when the mouse moves over the element.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: variant
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: The variant changes the shape of the avatar. Valid values are empty, circle, and square. This value defaults to square.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: size
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: The size of the avatar. Valid values are x-small, small, medium, and large. This value defaults to medium.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: src
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: The URL for the image.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: alternativeText
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: The alternative text used to describe the avatar, which is displayed as hover text on the image.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: fallbackIconName
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: The Lightning Design System name of the icon used as a fallback when the image fails to load. The initials fallback relies on this for its background color. Names are written in the format 'standard:account' where 'standard' is the category, and 'account' is the specific icon to be displayed. Only icons from the standard and custom categories are allowed.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: initials
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: If the record name contains two words, like first and last name, use the first capitalized letter of each. For records that only have a single word name, use the first two letters of that word using one capital and one lower case letter.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: href
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: The URL of the page that the breadcrumb goes to.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: onclick
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: The action triggered when the breadcrumb is clicked.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: name
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: The name for the breadcrumb component. This value is optional and can be used to identify the breadcrumb in a callback.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: accesskey
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION:
Inherited
Specifies a shortcut key to activate or focus an element.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: tabindex
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION:
Inherited
Specifies the tab order of an element when the Tab key is used for navigating. The tabindex value can be set to 0 or -1. The default is 0, which means that the component is focusable and participates in sequential keyboard navigation. -1 means that the component is focusable but does not participate in keyboard navigation.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: onfocus
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION:
Inherited
The action triggered when the element receives focus.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: onblur
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION:
Inherited
The action triggered when the element releases focus.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: class
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION:
Inherited
A CSS class for the outer element, in addition to the component's base classes.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: title
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION:
Inherited
Displays tooltip text when the mouse moves over the element.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: name
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: The name for the button element. This value is optional and can be used to identify the button in a callback.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: value
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: The value for the button element. This value is optional and can be used when submitting a form.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: label
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: The text to be displayed inside the button.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: variant
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: The variant changes the appearance of the button. Accepted variants include base, neutral, brand, destructive, inverse and success. This value defaults to neutral.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: iconName
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: The Lightning Design System name of the icon. Names are written in the format 'utility:down' where 'utility' is the category, and 'down' is the specific icon to be displayed.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: iconPosition
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Describes the position of the icon with respect to body. Options include left and right. This value defaults to left.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: disabled
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Specifies whether this button should be displayed in a disabled state. Disabled buttons can't be clicked. This value defaults to false.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: onclick
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: The action triggered when the button is clicked.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: type
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Specifies the type of button. Valid values are button, reset, and submit. This value defaults to button.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: ariaLabel
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Label describing the button to assistive technologies.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: ariaDescribedBy
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: A space-separated list of element IDs that provides descriptive labels for the button.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: ariaControls
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: A space-separated list of element IDs that this button controls the contents or presence of.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: ariaExpanded
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Indicates whether an element the button controls is expanded or collapsed. Valid values are 'true' or 'false'.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: ariaLive
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Indicates that the button will be updated. Valid values are 'assertive', 'polite', or 'off'.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: ariaAtomic
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Indicates whether assistive technologies will present all, or only parts of, the changed region. Valid values are 'true' or 'false'.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: focus
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Sets focus on the element.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: The value for the button element. This value is optional and can be used when submitting a form.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: iconName
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: The Lightning Design System name of the icon. Names are written in the format 'utility:down' where 'utility' is the category, and 'down' is the specific icon to be displayed. Only utility icons can be used in this component.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: iconClass
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: The class to be applied to the contained icon element.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: variant
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: The variant changes the appearance of buttonIcon. Accepted variants include bare, container, brand, border, border-filled, bare-inverse, and border-inverse. This value defaults to border.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: size
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: The size of the buttonIcon. For the bare variant, options include x-small, small, medium, and large. For non-bare variants, options include xx-small, x-small, small, and medium. This value defaults to medium.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: disabled
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Specifies whether this button should be displayed in a disabled state. Disabled buttons can't be clicked. This value defaults to false.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: alternativeText
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: The alternative text used to describe the icon. This text should describe what happens when you click the button, for example 'Upload File', not what the icon looks like, 'Paperclip'.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: onclick
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: The action that will be run when the button is clicked.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: type
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Specifies the type of button. Valid values are button, reset, and submit. This value defaults to button.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: tooltip
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Text to display when the user mouses over or focuses on the button. The tooltip is auto-positioned relative to the button and screen space.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: ariaLabel
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Label describing the button to assistive technologies.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: ariaDescribedBy

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: ariaExpanded
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Indicates whether an element the button controls is expanded or collapsed. Valid values are 'true' or 'false'.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: ariaLive
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Indicates that the button will be updated. Valid values are 'assertive', 'polite', or 'off'.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: ariaAtomic
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Indicates whether assistive technologies will present all, or only parts of, the changed region. Valid values are 'true' or 'false'.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: variant
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: The variant changes the look of the button. Accepted variants include bare, container, border, border-filled, bare-inverse, and border-inverse. This value defaults to border.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: onselect
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Action fired when a menu item is selected. The 'detail.menuItem' property of the passed event is the selected menu item.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: menuAlignment
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Determines the alignment of the menu relative to the button. Available options are: auto, left, center, right, bottom-left, bottom-center, bottom-right. The auto option aligns the dropdown menu based on available space. This value defaults to left.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: iconName
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: The name of the icon to be used in the format \'utility:down\'. This value defaults to utility:down. If an icon other than utility:down or utility:chevrondown is used, a utility:down icon is appended to the right of that icon.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: iconSize
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: The size of the icon. Options include xx-small, x-small, medium, or large. This value defaults to medium.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: disabled
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: If true, the menu is disabled. Disabling the menu prevents users from opening it. This value defaults to false.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: visible
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: If true, the menu items are displayed. This value defaults to false.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: alternativeText
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: The assistive text for the button.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: name
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: The name for the button element. This value is optional and can be used to identify the button in a callback.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: value
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: The value for the button element. This value is optional and can be used when submitting a form.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: isLoading
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: If true, the menu is in a loading state and shows a spinner. This value defaults to false.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: loadingStateAlternativeText
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Message displayed while the menu is in the loading state.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: isDraft
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: If true, the menu trigger shows a draft indicator. This value defaults to false.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: draftAlternativeText
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Describes the reason for showing the draft indicator. This is required when the isDraft attribute is true.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: tooltip
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Text to display when the user mouses over or focuses on the button. The tooltip is auto-positioned relative to the button and screen space.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: onopen
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Action fired when the menu is opened.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Sets focus on the element.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: labelWhenHover

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: iconNameWhenOff
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: The name of the icon to be used in the format \'utility:add\' when the state is false.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: iconNameWhenOn
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: The name of the icon to be used in the format \'utility:check\' when the state is true.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: iconNameWhenHover
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: The name of the icon to be used in the format \'utility:close\' when the state is true and the button receives focus.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: variant
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: The variant changes the appearance of the button. Accepted variants include brand, destructive, inverse, neutral, success, and text. This value defaults to neutral.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: The action triggered when the button is clicked.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: focus

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: iconName
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: The Lightning Design System name of the icon. Names are written in the format 'utility:down' where 'utility' is the category, and 'down' is the specific icon to be displayed. The icon is displayed in the header to the left of the title.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: actions
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Actions are components such as button or buttonIcon. Actions are displayed in the header.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: variant

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Specifies whether auto scroll is disabled. The default value is false.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: disableAutoRefresh

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: tabindex
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION:
Inherited
Specifies the tab order of an element when the Tab key is used for navigating. The tabindex value can be set to 0 or -1. The default is 0, which means that the component is focusable and participates in sequential keyboard navigation. -1 means that the component is focusable but does not participate in keyboard navigation.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: onfocus
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: The action triggered when the checkbox group receives focus.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: onblur
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: The action triggered when the checkbox group releases focus.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: The name of the checkbox group.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: label
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Text label for the checkbox group.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: options
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Array of label-value pairs for each checkbox.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: value
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: The list of selected checkboxes. Each array entry contains the value of a selected checkbox. The value of each checkbox is set in the options attribute.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: variant
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: The variant changes the appearance of the checkbox group. Accepted variants include standard, label-hidden, label-inline, and label-stacked. This value defaults to standard. Use label-hidden to hide the label but make it available to assistive technology. Use label-inline to horizontally align the label and checkbox group. Use label-stacked to place the label above the checkbox group.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: messageWhenValueMissing
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Optional message displayed when no checkbox is selected and the required attribute is set to true.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: required
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Set to true if at least one checkbox must be selected. This value defaults to false.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: disabled
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Set to true if the checkbox group is disabled. Checkbox selections can't be changed for a disabled checkbox group. This value defaults to false.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: onchange
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: The action triggered when a checkbox value changes.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: focus
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Sets focus on the element.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: checkValidity
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Indicates whether the checkbox group has any validity errors.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: reportValidity
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Display error messages if the checkbox group is invalid.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: setCustomValidity
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.ARGUMENTS:
NAME	TYPE	DESCRIPTION
message	string	The string that describes the error. If message is an empty string, the error message is reset.
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Sets a custom error message to be displayed when the checkbox group input is submitted.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: showHelpMessageIfInvalid
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Displays error messages. The checkbox group is invalid if it fails at least one constraint validation and when checkValidity() returns false.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: message
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: The string that describes the error. If message is an empty string, the error message is reset.

This value defaults to standard, which displays the label above the field. Use label-hidden to hide the label but make it available to assistive technology. Use label-inline to horizontally align the label and input field. Use label-stacked to place the label above the input field.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: disabled

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: required

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: label
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Text label for the combobox.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: placeholder
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Text that is displayed before an option is selected, to prompt the user to select an option. The default is "Select an Option".

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: dropdownAlignment
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Specifies where the drop-down list is aligned with or anchored to the selection field. By default the list is aligned with the selection field at the top so the list opens down. Use bottom-left to make the selection field display at the bottom so the list opens above it. Use auto to let the component determine where to open the list based on space available.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: messageWhenValueMissing

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: fieldLevelHelp

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: spinnerActive
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Displays a spinner to indicate activity in the dropdown list. This value defaults to false.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Displays error messages. The combobox is invalid if it fails at least one constraint validation and when checkValidity() returns false.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: checkValidity
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Returns the valid property value (Boolean) on the ValidityState object to indicate whether the combobox has any validity errors.

message	string	The string that describes the error. If message is an empty string, the error message is reset.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Display error messages if the combobox is invalid.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: message
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: The string that describes the error. If message is an empty string, the error message is reset.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: onerror

A CSS class for the outer element, in addition to the component's base classes.

Displays tooltip text when the mouse moves over the element.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: columns
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Array of the columns object that's used to define the data types. Required properties include 'label', 'dataKey', and 'type'. The default type is 'text'.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: data
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: The array of data to be displayed.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: keyField
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Required for better performance. Associates each row with a unique ID.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: hideCheckboxColumn
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Hides or displays the checkbox column for row selection. To hide the checkbox column, set hideCheckboxColumn to true. The default is false.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: hideTableHeader
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Specifies whether the table header should be hidden.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: resizeColumnDisabled
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Specifies whether column resizing is disabled. The default is false.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: suppressBottomBar
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Specifies whether the inline edit Save/Cancel bottom bar should be hidden.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: minColumnWidth
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: The minimum width for all columns. The default is 50px.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: maxColumnWidth
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: The maximum width for all columns. The default is 1000px.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: resizeStep
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: The width to resize the column when user press left or right arrow. The default is 10px.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: sortedBy
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: The column fieldName that controls the sorting order. Sort the data using the onsort event handler.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: sortedDirection
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Specifies the sorting direction. Sort the data using the onsort event handler. Valid options include 'asc' and 'desc'.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: defaultSortDirection
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Specifies the default sorting direction on an unsorted column. Valid options include 'asc' and 'desc'. The default is 'asc' for sorting in ascending order.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: showRowNumberColumn
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Shows or hides the row number column. Set to true to show the row number column. The default is false.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: rowNumberOffset
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Determines where to start counting the row number. The default is 0.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: enableInfiniteLoading
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Enables or disables infinite loading. The default is false.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: loadMoreOffset
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Determines when to trigger infinite loading based on how many pixels the table's scroll position is from the bottom of the table. The default is 20.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: isLoading
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Specifies whether more data is being loaded and displays a spinner if so. The default is false.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: maxRowSelection
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: The maximum number of rows that can be selected. Checkboxes are used for selection by default, and radio buttons are used when maxRowSelection is 1.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: selectedRows
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Enables programmatic row selection with a list of keyField values.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: errors
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Specifies an object containing information about cell level, row level, and table level errors. When it's set, error messages are displayed on the table accordingly.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: draftValues
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: The current values per row that are provided during inline edit.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: oncellchange
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: The action triggered when a cell's value changes after an inline edit. Returns the draftValues object.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: onloadmore
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: The action triggered when infinite loading loads more data.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: onrowselection
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: The action triggered when a row is selected. Returns the selectedRows object.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: onsort
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: The action triggered when a column is sorted. Returns fieldName and sortDirection.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: onheaderaction
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: The action triggered when a header action is clicked. By default, it also closes the header actions menu. Returns the action and columnDefinition objects.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: onrowaction
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: The action triggered when a row action is clicked. By default, it also closes the row actions menu. Returns the eventDetails object.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: onresize
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: The action triggered when the table renders columns the first time and every time its resized an specific column. Returns columnWidths.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: onsave
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: The action triggered when clicking on the table footer bar's save button during inline edit. Returns the draftValues object.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: oncancel
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: The action triggered when clicking on the table footer bar's cancel button during inline edit. All edited cells are reverted to their original values.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: getSelectedRows
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Returns an array of data in each selected row.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: body

Inherited from aura:component
The body of the component. In markup, this is everything in the body of the tag.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: name
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION:
Inherited
Specifies the name of an input element.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: value
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION:
Inherited
Specifies the value of an input element.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: variant
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: The variant changes the appearance of the dual listbox. Accepted variants include standard, label-inline, label-hidden, and label-stacked. This value defaults to standard. Use label-hidden to hide the label but make it available to assistive technology. Use label-inline to horizontally align the label and dual listbox. Use label-stacked to place the label above the dual listbox.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: disabled
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION:
Inherited
Specifies that an input element should be disabled. This value defaults to false.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: readonly
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION:
Inherited
Specifies that an input field is read-only. This value defaults to false.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: required
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION:
Inherited
Specifies that an input field must be filled out before submitting the form. This value defaults to false.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: validity
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION:
Inherited
Represents the validity states that an element can be in, with respect to constraint validation.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: onchange
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION:
Inherited
The action triggered when a value attribute changes.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: accesskey
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION:
Inherited
Specifies a shortcut key to activate or focus an element.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: tabindex
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION:
Inherited
Specifies the tab order of an element when the Tab key is used for navigating. The tabindex value can be set to 0 or -1. The default is 0, which means that the component is focusable and participates in sequential keyboard navigation. -1 means that the component is focusable but does not participate in keyboard navigation.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: onfocus
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION:
Inherited
The action triggered when the element receives focus.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: onblur
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION:
Inherited
The action triggered when the element releases focus.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: label
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Label for the dual listbox.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: sourceLabel
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Label for source options listbox.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: selectedLabel
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Label for selected options listbox.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: options
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: A list of options that are available for selection. Each option has the following attributes: label and value.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: downButtonLabel
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Label for down button.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: removeButtonLabel
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Label for remove button.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: addButtonLabel
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Label for add button.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: upButtonLabel
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Label for up button.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: requiredOptions
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: A list of required options that cannot be removed from selected options listbox. This list is populated with values from options attribute.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: values
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: A list of default options that are included in the selected options listbox. This list is populated with values from the options attribute.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: fieldLevelHelp
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Help text detailing the purpose and function of the dual listbox.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: min
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Minimum number of options required in the selected options listbox.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: max
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Maximum number of options required in the selected options listbox.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: disableReordering
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Set to true to hide the Up and Down buttons used for reordering the Selected list items.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: size
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Number of items that display before vertical scrollbars are displayed for the listboxes. Determines the vertical size of the dual listbox.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: showActivityIndicator
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Displays a spinner to indicate activity in the listbox. This value defaults to false.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: showHelpMessageIfInvalid
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Shows the help message if the form control is in an invalid state.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: focus
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Sets focus on the element.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: checkValidity
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Returns the valid property value (Boolean) on the ValidityState object to indicate whether the dual listbox has any validity errors.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: setCustomValidity
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.ARGUMENTS:
NAME	TYPE	DESCRIPTION
message	string	The string that describes the error. If message is an empty string, the error message is reset.
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Sets a custom error message to be displayed when the dual listbox value is submitted.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: reportValidity
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Display error messages if the dual listbox is invalid.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: message
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: The string that describes the error. If message is an empty string, the error message is reset.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: type
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: The Lightning Design System name of the dynamicIcon. Valid values are: ellie, eq, score, strength, trend, and waffle.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: option
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: The option attribute changes the appearance of the dynamicIcon. The options available depend on the type attribute. For eq: play (default) or stop For score: positive (default) or negative For strength: -3, -2, -1, 0 (default), 1, 2, 3 For trend: neutral (default), up, or down

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: alternativeText
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: The alternative text used to describe the dynamicIcon. This text should describe what’s happening. For example, 'Graph is refreshing', not what the icon looks like, 'Graph'.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: onclick
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: The action triggered when the icon is clicked.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: subscribe
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.ARGUMENTS:
NAME	TYPE	DESCRIPTION
channel	string	The channel name to subscribe to.
replayId	long	Indicates what point in the stream to replay events from. Specify -1 to get new events from the tip of the stream, -2 to replay from the last saved event, or a specific event replay ID to get all saved and new events after that ID.
onMessageCallback	function	A callback function that's invoked for every event received.
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Subscribes to a given channel and returns a promise that holds a subscription object, which you use to unsubscribe later.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: unsubscribe
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.ARGUMENTS:
NAME	TYPE	DESCRIPTION
subscription	object	Subscription object that the subscribe call returned.
callback	function	A callback function that's called with a server response for the unsubscribe call.
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Unsubscribes from the channel using the given subscription object and returns a promise. The result of this operation is passed in to the callback function. The result object holds the successful Boolean field which indicates whether the unsubscribe() operation was successful. The result fields are based on the CometD protocol for the unsubscribe operation. See https://docs.cometd.org/current3/reference/#_bayeux_meta_unsubscribe.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: onError
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.ARGUMENTS:
NAME	TYPE	DESCRIPTION
callback	function	A callback function that's called when an error response is received from the server for handshake, connect, subscribe, and unsubscribe meta channels.
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Registers a listener to errors that the server returns.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: setDebugFlag
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.ARGUMENTS:
NAME	TYPE	DESCRIPTION
flag	boolean	Set to true or false to turn console logging on or off respectively.
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Turns console logging on or off.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: isEmpEnabled
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Returns a promise that holds a Boolean value. The value is true if the EmpJs Streaming API library can be used in this context; otherwise false.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: channel
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: The channel name to subscribe to.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: replayId
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Indicates what point in the stream to replay events from. Specify -1 to get new events from the tip of the stream, -2 to replay from the last saved event, or a specific event replay ID to get all saved and new events after that ID.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: onMessageCallback
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: A callback function that's invoked for every event received.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: subscription
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Subscription object that the subscribe call returned.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: callback
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: A callback function that's called with a server response for the unsubscribe call.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: callback
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: A callback function that's called when an error response is received from the server for handshake, connect, subscribe, and unsubscribe meta channels.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: flag
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Set to true or false to turn console logging on or off respectively.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: timeZone

Specify a time zone listed in the IANA time zone database (https://www.iana.org/time-zones). For example, set the value to 'Pacific/Honolulu' to display Hawaii time. The short code UTC is also accepted.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: The format for which to display the name. Valid values include short, medium, and long. This value defaults to long.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION:
Inherited from aura:component
The body of the component. In markup, this is everything in the body of the tag.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: class
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION:
Inherited
A CSS class for the outer element, in addition to the component's base classes.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: title
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION:
Inherited
Displays tooltip text when the mouse moves over the element.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: value
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: The value to be formatted.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: style
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: The number formatting style to use. Possible values are decimal, currency, and percent. This value defaults to decimal.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: currencyCode
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Only used if style='currency', this attribute determines which currency is displayed. Possible values are the ISO 4217 currency codes, such as 'USD' for the US dollar.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: currencyDisplayAs
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Determines how currency is displayed. Possible values are symbol, code, and name. This value defaults to symbol.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: minimumIntegerDigits
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: The minimum number of integer digits that are required. Possible values are from 1 to 21.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: minimumFractionDigits
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: The minimum number of fraction digits that are required.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: maximumFractionDigits
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: The maximum number of fraction digits that are allowed.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: minimumSignificantDigits
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: The minimum number of significant digits that are required. Possible values are from 1 to 21.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: maximumSignificantDigits
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: The maximum number of significant digits that are allowed. Possible values are from 1 to 21.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: body
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION:

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: title

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: value
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Sets the phone number to display.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: onclick
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: The action triggered when the phone number is clicked.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION:

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION:

A CSS class for the outer element, in addition to the component's base classes.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: title
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION:

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: value
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Sets the rich text to display.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: disableLinkify
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Prevents the component from creating links in the rich text.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: body
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION:
Inherited from aura:component
The body of the component. In markup, this is everything in the body of the tag.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: value
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Text to output.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: linkify
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Specifies whether the text should be converted to a link. If set to true, URLs and email addresses are displayed in anchor tags.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: body
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION:
Inherited from aura:component
The body of the component. In markup, this is everything in the body of the tag.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: class
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION:
Inherited
A CSS class for the outer element, in addition to the component's base classes.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: title
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION:
Inherited
Displays tooltip text when the mouse moves over the element.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: value
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: The time value to format.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: body
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION:
Inherited from aura:component
The body of the component. In markup, this is everything in the body of the tag.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: class
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION:
Inherited
A CSS class for the outer element, in addition to the component's base classes.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: title
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION:

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: value
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: The URL to be formatted.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: target
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Specifies where to open the link. Options include _blank, _parent, _self, and _top.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: label
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: The text to display in the link.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: tooltip
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: The text to display when the mouse hovers over the link.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: body
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION:
Inherited from aura:component
The body of the component. In markup, this is everything in the body of the tag.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: class
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION:
Inherited
A CSS class for the outer element, in addition to the component's base classes.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: title
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION:
Inherited
Displays tooltip text when the mouse moves over the element.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: content
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Text to be shown in the popover.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: iconName
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: The Lightning Design System name of the icon used as the visible element. Names are written in the format 'utility:info' where 'utility' is the category, and 'info' is the specific icon to be displayed. The default value is 'utility:info'.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: iconVariant
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: The iconVariant changes the appearance of the icon. Accepted variants include inverse, warning, error.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: body
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION:
Inherited from aura:component
The body of the component. In markup, this is everything in the body of the tag.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: class
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION:
Inherited
A CSS class for the outer element, in addition to the component's base classes.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: title
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION:
Inherited
Displays tooltip text when the mouse moves over the element.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: iconName
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: The Lightning Design System name of the icon. Names are written in the format 'utility:down' where 'utility' is the category, and 'down' is the specific icon to be displayed.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: size
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: The size of the icon. Options include xx-small, x-small, small, medium, or large. This value defaults to medium.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: variant
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: The variant changes the appearance of a utility icon. Accepted variants include inverse, success, warning, and error. Use the inverse variant to implement a white fill in utility icons on dark backgrounds.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: alternativeText
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: The alternative text used to describe the icon. This text should describe what happens when you click the button, for example 'Upload File', not what the icon looks like, 'Paperclip'.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: src
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: A uri path to a custom svg sprite, including the name of the resouce, for example: /assets/icons/standard-sprite/svg/test.svg#icon-heart

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: body
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION:
Inherited from aura:component
The body of the component. In markup, this is everything in the body of the tag.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: name
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION:
Inherited
Specifies the name of an input element.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: value
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION:
Inherited
Specifies the value of an input element.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: variant
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION:
Inherited
The variant changes the appearance of an input field. Accepted variants include standard, label-inline, label-hidden, and label-stacked. This value defaults to standard, which displays the label above the field. Use label-hidden to hide the label but make it available to assistive technology. Use label-inline to horizontally align the label and input field. Use label-stacked to place the label above the input field.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: disabled
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION:
Inherited
Specifies that an input element should be disabled. This value defaults to false.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: readonly
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION:
Inherited
Specifies that an input field is read-only. This value defaults to false.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: required
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION:
Inherited
Specifies that an input field must be filled out before submitting the form. This value defaults to false.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: validity
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION:
Inherited
Represents the validity states that an element can be in, with respect to constraint validation.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: onchange
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION:
Inherited
The action triggered when a value attribute changes.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: accesskey
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION:
Inherited
Specifies a shortcut key to activate or focus an element.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: tabindex
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION:
Inherited
Specifies the tab order of an element when the Tab key is used for navigating. The tabindex value can be set to 0 or -1. The default is 0, which means that the component is focusable and participates in sequential keyboard navigation. -1 means that the component is focusable but does not participate in keyboard navigation.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: onfocus
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION:
Inherited
The action triggered when the element receives focus.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: onblur
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION:
Inherited
The action triggered when the element releases focus.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: class
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION:
Inherited
A CSS class for the outer element, in addition to the component's base classes.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: title
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION:
Inherited
Displays tooltip text when the mouse moves over the element.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: type
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: The type of the input. This value defaults to text.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: label
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Text label for the input.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: formatter
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: String value with the formatter to be used for number input. Valid values include decimal, percent, percent-fixed, and currency.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: files
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: A FileList that contains selected files. Use this attribute with file input type only.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: isLoading
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: For the search type only. Specifies whether the spinner is displayed to indicate that data is loading. This value defaults to false.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: placeholder
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Text that is displayed when the field is empty, to prompt the user for a valid entry.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: maxlength
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: The maximum number of characters allowed in the field. Use this attribute with email, password, search, tel, text, and url input types only.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: minlength
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: The minimum number of characters allowed in the field. Use this attribute with email, password, search, tel, text, and url input types only.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: pattern
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Specifies the regular expression that the input's value is checked against. Use this attribute with email, password, search, tel, text, and url input types only.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: autocomplete
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Controls auto-filling of the field. Use this attribute with email, search, tel, text, and url input types only. Set the attribute to pass through autocomplete values to be interpreted by the browser.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: fieldLevelHelp
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Help text detailing the purpose and function of the input. This attribute isn't supported for file, radio, toggle, and checkbox-button types.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: max
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: The maximum acceptable value for the input. Use this attribute with number, range, date, time, and datetime input types only. For number and range type, the max value is a decimal number. For the date, time, and datetime types, the max value must use a valid string for the type.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: min
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: The minimum acceptable value for the input. Use this attribute with number, range, date, time, and datetime input types only. For number and range types, the min value is a decimal number. For the date, time, and datetime types, the min value must use a valid string for the type.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: step
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Granularity of the value, specified as a positive floating point number. Use this attribute with number and range input types only. Use 'any' when granularity is not a concern. This value defaults to 1.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: checked
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Specifies whether the checkbox is checked. This value defaults to false.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: timezone
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Specifies the time zone used when type='datetime' only. This value defaults to the user’s Salesforce time zone setting.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: dateStyle
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: The display style of the date when type='date' or type='datetime'. Valid values are short, medium (default), and long. The format of each style is specific to the locale. On mobile devices this attribute has no effect.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: timeStyle
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: The display style of the time when type='time' or type='datetime'. Valid values are short (default), medium, and long. Currently, medium and long styles look the same. On mobile devices this attribute has no effect.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: accept
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Specifies the types of files that the server accepts. Use this attribute with file input type only.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: multiple
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Specifies that a user can enter more than one value. Use this attribute with file and email input types only.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: messageWhenBadInput
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Error message to be displayed when a bad input is detected.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: messageWhenPatternMismatch
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Error message to be displayed when a pattern mismatch is detected.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: messageWhenTypeMismatch
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Error message to be displayed when a type mismatch is detected.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: messageWhenValueMissing
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Error message to be displayed when the value is missing.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: messageWhenRangeOverflow
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Error message to be displayed when a range overflow is detected.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: messageWhenRangeUnderflow
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Error message to be displayed when a range underflow is detected.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: messageWhenStepMismatch
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Error message to be displayed when a step mismatch is detected.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: messageWhenTooLong
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Error message to be displayed when the value is too long.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: messageWhenTooShort
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Error message to be displayed when the value is too short.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: messageToggleActive
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Text shown for the active state of a toggle. The default is "Active".

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: messageToggleInactive
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Text shown for then inactive state of a toggle. The default is "Inactive".

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: ariaLabel
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Describes the input to assistive technologies.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: ariaLabelledBy
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: A space-separated list of element IDs that provide labels for the input.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: ariaDescribedBy
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: A space-separated list of element IDs that provide descriptive labels for the input.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: ariaControls
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: A space-separated list of element IDs whose presence or content is controlled by the input.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: timeAriaLabel
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Describes the time input to assistive technologies when type=datetime. On mobile devices, this label is merged with ariaLabel and dateAriaLabel to describe the native date time input.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: timeAriaLabelledBy
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: A space-separated list of element IDs that provide labels for the time input when type=datetime. On mobile devices, this is merged with ariaLabelledBy and dateAriaLabelledBy to describe the native date time input.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: timeAriaDescribedBy
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: A space-separated list of element IDs that provide descriptive labels for the time input when type=datetime. On mobile devices, this is merged with ariaDescribedBy and dateAriaDescribedBy to describe the native date time input.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: timeAriaControls
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: A space-separated list of element IDs whose presence or content is controlled by the time input when type=datetime. On mobile devices, this is merged with ariaControls and dateAriaControls to describe the native date time input.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: dateAriaLabel
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Describes the date input to assistive technologies when type=datetime. On mobile devices, this label is merged with ariaLabel and timeAriaLabel to describe the native date time input.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: dateAriaLabelledBy
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: A space-separated list of element IDs that provide labels for the date input when type=datetime. On mobile devices, this is merged with ariaLabelledBy and timeAriaLabelledBy to describe the native date time input.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: dateAriaDescribedBy
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: A space-separated list of element IDs that provide descriptive labels for the date input when type=datetime. On mobile devices, this is merged with ariaDescribedBy and timeAriaDescribedBy to describe the native date time input.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: dateAriaControls
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: A space-separated list of element IDs whose presence or content is controlled by the date input when type=datetime. On mobile devices, this is merged with ariaControls and timeAriaControls to describe the native date time input.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: showHelpMessageIfInvalid
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Shows the help message if the form control is in an invalid state.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: focus
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Sets focus on the element.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: checkValidity
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Returns the valid property value (Boolean) on the ValidityState object to indicate whether the input has any validity errors.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: setCustomValidity
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.ARGUMENTS:
NAME	TYPE	DESCRIPTION
message	string	The string that describes the error. If message is an empty string, the error message is reset.
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Sets a custom error message to be displayed when the input value is submitted.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: reportValidity
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Display error messages if the input is invalid.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: message
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: The string that describes the error. If message is an empty string, the error message is reset.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: body
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION:
Inherited from aura:component
The body of the component. In markup, this is everything in the body of the tag.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: class
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION:
Inherited
A CSS class for the outer element, in addition to the component's base classes.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: title
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION:
Inherited
Displays tooltip text when the mouse moves over the element.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: addressLabel
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: The label of the address compound field.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: fieldLevelHelp
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Help text detailing the purpose and function of the address compound field.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: streetLabel
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: The label of the street field of the address.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: cityLabel
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: The label of the city field of the address.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: provinceLabel
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: The label of the province field of the address.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: countryLabel
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: The label of the country field of the address.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: postalCodeLabel
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: The label of the postal code field of the address.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: street
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: The street field of the address.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: city
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: The city field of the address.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: province
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: The province field of the address. If provinceOptions is provided, this province value is selected by default.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: provinceOptions
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: The array of label-value pairs for the province. Displays a dropdown menu of options.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: country
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: The country field of the address. If countryOptions is provided, this country value is selected by default.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: countryOptions
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: The array of label-value pairs for the country. Displays a dropdown menu of options.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: postalCode
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: The postal code field of the address.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: disabled

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Specifies whether to enable address lookup using Google Maps. This value defaults to false.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: variant
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: The variant changes the appearance of the address compound field. Accepted variants include standard, label-inline, label-hidden, and label-stacked. This value defaults to standard. Use label-hidden to hide the label but make it available to assistive technology. Use label-inline to horizontally align the label and address fields. Use label-stacked to place the label above the address fields.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: blur
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Removes focus from the element.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: checkValidity
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Returns the valid property value (Boolean) on the ValidityState object to indicate whether the compound field has any validity errors.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: reportValidity

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: showHelpMessageIfInvalid

Otherwise, it is determined by the density setting of the parent form.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: The longitude value. Longitude values must be within -180 and 180.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Specifies whether the compound field must be filled out. An error message is displayed if a user interacts with the field and does not provide a value. This value defaults to false.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Specifies whether the compound field should be disabled. Disabled fields are grayed out and not clickable. This value defaults to false.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: readonly
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Specifies whether the compound field is read-only. This value defaults to false.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: variant
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: The variant changes the appearance of the geolocation compound field. Accepted variants include standard, label-hidden, label-inline, and label-stacked. This value defaults to standard. This value defaults to standard. Use label-hidden to hide the label but make it available to assistive technology. Use label-inline to horizontally align the label and geolocation fields. Use label-stacked to place the label above the geolocation fields.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Returns the valid property value (Boolean) on the ValidityState object to indicate whether the latitude and longitude fields have validity errors.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: showHelpMessageIfInvalid
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Shows the help message if the latitude or longitude fields are in an invalid state.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: options
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Displays a list of salutation options, such as Dr. or Mrs., provided as label-value pairs.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: required
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Specifies whether the compound field must be filled out. A red asterisk is displayed on the Last Name field. An error message is displayed if a user interacts with the Last Name field and does not provide a value. This value defaults to false.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Specifies whether the compound field should be disabled. Disabled fields are grayed out and not clickable. This value defaults to false.

Use label-inline to horizontally align the label and name fields. Use label-stacked to place the label above the name fields.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Text label for the compound field.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: fieldsToDisplay
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: List of fields to be displayed on the component. This value defaults to ['firstName', 'salutation', 'lastName']. Other field values include middleName, informalName, suffix.

Specifies a shortcut key to activate or focus an element.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION:
Inherited
Specifies the tab order of an element when the Tab key is used for navigating. The tabindex value can be set to 0 or -1. The default is 0, which means that the component is focusable and participates in sequential keyboard navigation. -1 means that the component is focusable but does not participate in keyboard navigation.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Label describing the rich text editor to assistive technologies

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: ariaLabelledby
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: An element ID that provides a label for the rich text editor.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: ariaDescribedby
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: A space-separated list of element IDs that provides descriptive labels for the rich text editor.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: label
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Text label for the rich text editor.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: labelVisible
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Specifies whether the label is visible or not. The default is false.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: value
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: The HTML content in the rich text editor.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: placeholder
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Text that is displayed when the field is empty.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: disabledCategories
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: A comma-separated list of button categories to remove from the toolbar.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: disabled
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Specifies whether the editor is disabled. This value defaults to false.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: valid
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Specifies whether the editor content is valid. If invalid, the slds-has-error class is added. This value defaults to true.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: formats
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: A list of formats accepted by the text editor. By default, the list is computed based on enabled categories. The "table" format is always enabled to support copying and pasting of tables. If formats are specified, all desired formats must be specified. Omitting a format from the list removes the corresponding button.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: variant
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: The variant changes the appearance of the toolbar. Accepted variant is bottom-toolbar which causes the toolbar to be displayed below the text box.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: messageWhenBadInput
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Error message that's displayed when valid is false.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: shareWithEntityId
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Entity ID to share the image with.

format	object	A key-value pair with format names and values.
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Sets a format in the editor from the cursor point onwards. The format also applies to currently selected content. Only font, size, and align are supported.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: getFormat
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Returns an object representing the formats of the currently selected content. Only align, font, and size are supported.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: A key-value pair with format names and values.
