Displays tooltip text when the mouse moves over the element.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: horizontalAlign
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Determines how to spread the layout items horizontally. The alignment options are center, space, spread, and end.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: verticalAlign
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Determines how to spread the layout items vertically. The alignment options are start, center, end, and stretch.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: multipleRows
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Determines whether to wrap the child items when they exceed the layout width. If true, the items wrap to the following line. This value defaults to false.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: pullToBoundary
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Pulls layout items to the layout boundaries and corresponds to the padding size on the layout item. Possible values are small, medium, or large.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: body
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: The body of the component. In markup, this is everything in the body of the tag.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION:
Inherited
A CSS class for the outer element, in addition to the component's base classes.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: title
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION:
Inherited
Displays tooltip text when the mouse moves over the element.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: size
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: If the viewport is divided into 12 parts, size indicates the relative space the container occupies. Size is expressed as an integer from 1 through 12. This applies for all device-types.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: smallDeviceSize
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: If the viewport is divided into 12 parts, this attribute indicates the relative space the container occupies on device-types larger than mobile. It is expressed as an integer from 1 through 12.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: mediumDeviceSize
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: If the viewport is divided into 12 parts, this attribute indicates the relative space the container occupies on device-types larger than tablet. It is expressed as an integer from 1 through 12.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: largeDeviceSize
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: If the viewport is divided into 12 parts, this attribute indicates the relative space the container occupies on device-types larger than desktop. It is expressed as an integer from 1 through 12.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: flexibility
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Make the item fluid so that it absorbs any extra space in its container or shrinks when there is less space. Allowed values are: auto (columns grow or shrink equally as space allows), shrink (columns shrink equally as space decreases), no-shrink (columns don't shrink as space reduces), grow (columns grow equally as space increases), no-grow (columns don't grow as space increases), no-flex (columns don't grow or shrink as space changes). Use a comma-separated value for multiple options, such as 'auto, no-shrink'.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: padding
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Sets padding to either the right and left sides of a container, or all sides of a container. Allowed values are horizontal-small, horizontal-medium, horizontal-large, around-small, around-medium, around-large.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: alignmentBump
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Specifies a direction to bump the alignment of adjacent layout items. Allowed values are left, top, right, bottom.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: rows

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: showActionBar
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Specifies whether the action bar displays. This value defaults to false.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: enableInlineEdit
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Specifies whether the inline edit of cells is enabled. This value defaults to false.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: showRowLevelActions
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Specifies whether row level actions are displayed (as a dropdown menu in the last column of the row). This value defaults to false.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: showSearchBar
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Specifies whether the search bar displays. This value defaults to false. Note: The server side may still disable search if it does not support searching.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Corresponds to zoom levels defined in Google Maps API. If not specified, the map component automatically chooses an appropriate zoom level to show all markers with comfortable margins.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: mapMarkers
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Array containing one or more objects with the address or coordinates to be displayed.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: markersTitle
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Provides the heading title for the markers when the map uses multiple markers. The title is displayed as a header for the list of clickable addresses.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: center
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: A location to use as the map's center. If center is not specified, the map centers automatically.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: showFooter
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Shows footer with 'Open in Google Maps' link that opens an external window to display the selected marker location in Google Maps. Default value is false.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: listView
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Displays or hides the list of locations. Valid values are visible, hidden, or auto. This value defaults to auto, which shows the list only when multiple markers are present. Passing in an invalid value hides the list view.

The default is 0, which means that the component is focusable and participates in sequential keyboard navigation. -1 means that the component is focusable but does not participate in keyboard navigation.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: developerName
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: API name of the canvas app. This name is defined when the canvas app is created and can be viewed in the Canvas App Previewer. Either developerName or referenceId is required.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: applicationName
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Name or label of the canvas app. Used to display the app's name while Canvas is loading.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: namespacePrefix
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Namespace value of the Developer Edition organization in which the canvas app was created. Optional if the canvas app wasn’t created in a Developer Edition organization. If not specified, defaults to null.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: parameters
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Object representation of parameters passed to the canvas app. This should be supplied in JSON format or as a JavaScript object literal. Here’s an example of parameters in a JavaScript object literal: {param1:'value1',param2:'value2'}. If not specified, defaults to null.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: border
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Width of the canvas app border, in pixels. If not specified, defaults to 0 px.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: width
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Canvas app window width, in pixels. If not specified, defaults to 800 px.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: height
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Canvas app window height, in pixels. If not specified, defaults to 900 px.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: maxWidth
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: The maximum width of the Canvas app window in pixels. Defaults to 1000 px; 'infinite' is also a valid value.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: maxHeight
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: The maximum height of the Canvas app window in pixels. Defaults to 2000 px; 'infinite' is also a valid value.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: scrolling
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Canvas window scrolling

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: canvasId
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: An unique label within a page for the Canvas app window. This should be used when targeting events to this canvas app.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: containerId
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: An html element id in which canvas app is rendered. The container needs to be defined before canvasApp cmp usage.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: onCanvasAppLoad
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: The action triggered when the canvas app loads.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: onCanvasSubscribed
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: The action triggered after the canvas app registers with the parent.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: onCanvasAppError
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: The action triggered if the canvas app fails to render.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: displayLocation
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: The location in the application where the canvas app is currently being called from.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: sublocation
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: The sublocation is the location in the application where the canvas app is currently being called from, for ex, displayLocation can be PageLayout and sublocation can be S1MobileCardPreview or S1MobileCardFullview, etc

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: referenceId
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: The referenceId attribute is deprecated. Use developerName instead.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: A CSS class for the anchor tag.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: label
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: The text displayed in the link.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: routeInput

The body of the component. In markup, this is everything in the body of the tag.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: recordId
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Id of the current entity in the context of which the component is being displayed.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: dashboardId
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: The unique ID of the dashboard. You can get a dashboard’s ID, an 18-character code beginning with 0FK, from the dashboard's URL, or you can request it through the API. This attribute can be used instead of the developer name, but it can't be included if the name has been set. One of the two is required.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: developerName
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: The unique developer name of the dashboard. You can request the developer name through the API. This attribute can be used instead of the dashboard ID, but it can't be included if the ID has been set. One of the two is required.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: hideOnError
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Controls whether or not users see a dashboard that has an error. When this attribute is set to true, if the dashboard has an error, it won’t appear on the page. When set to false, the dashboard appears but doesn’t show any data. An error can occur when a user doesn't have access to the dashboard or it has been deleted.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: height
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Specifies the height of the dashboard, in pixels.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: showSharing
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: If true, and the dashboard is shareable, then the dashboard shows the Share icon. If false, the dashboard doesn't show the Share icon. To show the Share icon in the dashboard, the smallest supported frame size is 800 x 612 pixels.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: showTitle
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: If true, the dashboard’s title is included above the dashboard. If false, the dashboard appears without a title.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: showHeader
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: If true, the dashboard is displayed with a header bar that includes dashboard information and controls. If false, the dashboard appears without a header bar. Note that the header bar automatically appears when either showSharing or showTitle is true.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: rendered
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Specifies whether or not the component is rendered on the page.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: filter
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Adds selections or filters to the embedded dashboard at runtime. The filter attribute is configured using JSON. For filtering by dimension, use this syntax: {'datasets' : {'dataset1': [ {'fields': ['field1'], 'selection': ['$value1', '$value2']}, {'fields': ['field2'], 'filter': { 'operator': 'operator1', 'values': ['$value3', '$value4']}}]}}. For filtering on measures, use this syntax: {'datasets' : {'dataset1': [ {'fields': ['field1'], 'selection': ['$value1', '$value2']}, {'fields': ['field2'], 'filter': { 'operator': 'operator1', 'values': [[$value3]]}}]}}. With the selection option, the dashboard is shown with all its data, and the specified dimension values are highlighted. With the filter option, the dashboard is shown with only filtered data. For more information, see https://help.salesforce.com/articleView?id=bi_embed_community_builder.htm.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: openLinksInNewWindow
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: If false, links to other dashboards will be opened in the same window.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: accessToken
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: A valid access token obtained by logging into Salesforce. Useful when the component is used by Lightning Out in a non-Salesforce domain.

NAME	TYPE	DESCRIPTION

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Validate that the pre-chat fields have the necessary attributes and match what’s defined in setup. Returns an object with information about whether the pre-chat fields are valid for starting a chat, and details for any invalid fields.
