https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: recordId
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Id of the current entity in the context of which the component is being displayed.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: dashboardId
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: The unique ID of the dashboard. You can get a dashboard’s ID, an 18-character code beginning with 0FK, from the dashboard's URL, or you can request it through the API. This attribute can be used instead of the developer name, but it can't be included if the name has been set. One of the two is required.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: developerName
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: The unique developer name of the dashboard. You can request the developer name through the API. This attribute can be used instead of the dashboard ID, but it can't be included if the ID has been set. One of the two is required.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: hideOnError
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Controls whether or not users see a dashboard that has an error. When this attribute is set to true, if the dashboard has an error, it won’t appear on the page. When set to false, the dashboard appears but doesn’t show any data. An error can occur when a user doesn't have access to the dashboard or it has been deleted.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: height
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Specifies the height of the dashboard, in pixels.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: showSharing
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: If true, and the dashboard is shareable, then the dashboard shows the Share icon. If false, the dashboard doesn't show the Share icon. To show the Share icon in the dashboard, the smallest supported frame size is 800 x 612 pixels.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: showTitle
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: If true, the dashboard’s title is included above the dashboard. If false, the dashboard appears without a title.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: showHeader
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: If true, the dashboard is displayed with a header bar that includes dashboard information and controls. If false, the dashboard appears without a header bar. Note that the header bar automatically appears when either showSharing or showTitle is true.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: rendered
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Specifies whether or not the component is rendered on the page.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: filter
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Adds selections or filters to the embedded dashboard at runtime. The filter attribute is configured using JSON. For filtering by dimension, use this syntax: {'datasets' : {'dataset1': [ {'fields': ['field1'], 'selection': ['$value1', '$value2']}, {'fields': ['field2'], 'filter': { 'operator': 'operator1', 'values': ['$value3', '$value4']}}]}}. For filtering on measures, use this syntax: {'datasets' : {'dataset1': [ {'fields': ['field1'], 'selection': ['$value1', '$value2']}, {'fields': ['field2'], 'filter': { 'operator': 'operator1', 'values': [[$value3]]}}]}}. With the selection option, the dashboard is shown with all its data, and the specified dimension values are highlighted. With the filter option, the dashboard is shown with only filtered data. For more information, see https://help.salesforce.com/articleView?id=bi_embed_lightning.htm.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: openLinksInNewWindow
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: If false, links to other dashboards will be opened in the same window.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: accessToken
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: A valid access token obtained by logging into Salesforce. Useful when the component is used by Lightning Out in a non salesforce domain.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: title
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Displays tooltip text when the mouse moves over the element.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: active-section-name
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Changes the default expanded section. The first section in the accordion is expanded by default.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: allow-multiple-sections-open
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: If present, the accordion allows multiple open sections. Otherwise, opening a section closes another that's currently open.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: default
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Placeholder for accordion-section components.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: name
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: The unique section name to use with the active-section-name attribute in the accordion component.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: label
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: The text that displays as the title of the section.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: title
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Displays a tooltip text when the mouse moves over the element.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: actions
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Placeholder for actionable components, such as lightning-button or lightning-button-menu. Actions are displayed at the top right corner of the accordion section.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: default
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Placeholder for your content in the accordion section.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: alternative-text
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: The alternative text used to describe the avatar, which is displayed as hover text on the image.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: fallback-icon-name
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: The Lightning Design System name of the icon used as a fallback when the image fails to load. The initials fallback relies on this for its background color. Names are written in the format 'standard:account' where 'standard' is the category, and 'account' is the specific icon to be displayed. Only icons from the standard and custom categories are allowed.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: initials
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: If the record name contains two words, like first and last name, use the first capitalized letter of each. For records that only have a single word name, use the first two letters of that word using one capital and one lower case letter.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: size
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: The size of the avatar. Valid values are x-small, small, medium, and large. This value defaults to medium.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: src
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: The URL for the image.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: variant
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: The variant changes the shape of the avatar. Valid values are empty, circle, and square. This value defaults to square.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: label
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: The text to be displayed inside the badge.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: href
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: The URL of the page that the breadcrumb goes to.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: label
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: The text label for the breadcrumb.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: name
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: The name for the breadcrumb component. This value is optional and can be used to identify the breadcrumb in a callback.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: default
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Placeholder for lightning-breadcrumb

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: variant
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: The variant changes the look of the button. Accepted variants include bare, container, border, border-filled, bare-inverse, and border-inverse. This value defaults to border.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: icon-size
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: The size of the icon. Options include xx-small, x-small, medium, or large. This value defaults to medium.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: icon-name
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: The name of the icon to be used in the format 'utility:down'. If an icon other than 'utility:down' or 'utility:chevrondown' is used, a utility:down icon is appended to the right of that icon. This value defaults to utility:down.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: value
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: The value for the button element. This value is optional and can be used when submitting a form.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: alternative-text
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: The assistive text for the button.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: loading-state-alternative-text
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Message displayed while the menu is in the loading state.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: label
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Optional text to be shown on the button.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: draft-alternative-text
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Describes the reason for showing the draft indicator. This is required when is-draft is true.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: menu-alignment
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Determines the alignment of the menu relative to the button. Available options are: auto, left, center, right, bottom-left, bottom-center, bottom-right. The auto option aligns the dropdown menu based on available space. This value defaults to left.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: disabled
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: If present, the menu can be opened by users.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: nubbin
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: If present, a nubbin is present on the menu. A nubbin is a stub that protrudes from the menu item towards the button menu. The nubbin position is based on the menu-alignment.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: title
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Displays tooltip text when the mouse moves over the button menu.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: is-draft
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: If present, the menu trigger shows a draft indicator.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: is-loading
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: If present, the menu is in a loading state and shows a spinner.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: access-key
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: The keyboard shortcut for the button menu.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: tab-index
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Reserved for internal use. Use tabindex instead to indicate if an element should be focusable. tabindex can be set to 0 or -1. The default tabindex value is 0, which means that the button is focusable and participates in sequential keyboard navigation. -1 means that the button is focusable but does not participate in keyboard navigation.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: tooltip
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Text to display when the user mouses over or focuses on the button. The tooltip is auto-positioned relative to the button and screen space.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: focus
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Sets focus on the button.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: default
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Placeholder for menu-item

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: icon-name-when-on
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: The name of the icon to be used in the format 'utility:check' when the state is true.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: icon-name-when-off
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: The name of the icon to be used in the format 'utility:add' when the state is false.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: icon-name-when-hover
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: The name of the icon to be used in the format 'utility:close' when the state is true and the button receives focus.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: label-when-off
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: The text to be displayed inside the button when state is false.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: label-when-on
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: The text to be displayed inside the button when state is true.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: label-when-hover
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: The text to be displayed inside the button when state is true and the button receives focus.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: variant
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: The variant changes the appearance of the button. Accepted variants include brand, destructive, inverse, neutral, success, and text.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: selected
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: If present, the button is in the selected state.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: focus
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Sets focus on the button.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: title
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: The title can include text, and is displayed in the header. To include additional markup or another component, use the title slot.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: icon-name
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: The Lightning Design System name of the icon. Names are written in the format 'utility:down' where 'utility' is the category, and 'down' is the specific icon to be displayed. The icon is displayed in the header to the left of the title.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: variant
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: The variant changes the appearance of the card. Accepted variants include base or narrow. This value defaults to base.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: title
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Placeholder for the card title, which can be represented by a header or h1 element. The title is displayed at the top of the card, to the right of the icon. Alternatively, use the title attribute if you don't need to pass in extra markup in your title.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: actions
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Placeholder for actionable components, such as lightning-button or lightning-button-menu. Actions are displayed on the top right corner of the card next to the title.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: footer
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Placeholder for the card footer, which is displayed at the bottom of the card and is usually optional. For example, the footer can display a "View All" link to navigate to a list view.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: default
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Placeholder for your content in the card body.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: disable-auto-scroll
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: If present, images do not automatically scroll and users must click the indicators to scroll.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: disable-auto-refresh
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: If present, the carousel stops looping after the last item is displayed.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: scroll-duration
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: The auto scroll duration. The default is 5 seconds, after that the next image is displayed.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: default
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Placeholder for carousel-image. Up to 5 carousel-image components are allowed.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: label
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Text label for the checkbox group.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: options
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Array of label-value pairs for each checkbox.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: message-when-value-missing
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Optional message to be displayed when no checkbox is selected and the required attribute is set.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: name
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: The name of the checkbox group.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: value
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: The list of selected checkboxes. Each array entry contains the value of a selected checkbox. The value of each checkbox is set in the options attribute.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: disabled
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: If present, the checkbox group is disabled. Checkbox selections can't be changed for a disabled checkbox group.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: required
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: If present, at least one checkbox must be selected.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: variant
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: The variant changes the appearance of the checkbox group. Accepted variants include standard, label-hidden, label-inline, and label-stacked. This value defaults to standard. Use label-hidden to hide the label but make it available to assistive technology. Use label-inline to horizontally align the label and checkbox group. Use label-stacked to place the label above the checkbox group.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: validity
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Represents the validity states that an element can be in, with respect to constraint validation.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: checkValidity
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Returns the valid attribute value (Boolean) on the ValidityState object.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: reportValidity
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Displays the error messages and returns false if the input is invalid. If the input is valid, reportValidity() clears displayed error messages and returns true.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: setCustomValidity
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.ARGUMENTS:
NAME	TYPE	DESCRIPTION
message	unknown	The string that describes the error. If message is an empty string, the error message is reset.
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Sets a custom error message to be displayed when the checkbox value is submitted.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: showHelpMessageIfInvalid
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Displays an error message if the checkbox value is required and no option is selected.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: focus
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Sets focus on the first checkbox input element.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: message
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: The string that describes the error. If message is an empty string, the error message is reset.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: value
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: The phone number to be dialed.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: record-id
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: The Salesforce record Id that's associated with the phone number. This Id is passed by the component and does not get validated.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: params
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Comma-separated list of parameters to pass to the third-party phone system.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: label
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Text label for the combobox.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: dropdown-alignment
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Specifies where the drop-down list is aligned with or anchored to the selection field. By default the list is aligned with the selection field at the top left so the list opens down. Use bottom-left to make the selection field display at the bottom so the list opens above it. Use auto to let the component determine where to open the list based on space available.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: placeholder
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Text that is displayed before an option is selected, to prompt the user to select an option. The default is "Select an Option".

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: message-when-value-missing
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Error message to be displayed when the value is missing and input is required.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: name
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Specifies the name of the combobox.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: field-level-help
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Help text detailing the purpose and function of the combobox.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: variant
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: The variant changes the appearance of the combobox. Accepted variants include standard, label-hidden, label-inline, and label-stacked. This value defaults to standard. Use label-hidden to hide the label but make it available to assistive technology. Use label-inline to horizontally align the label and combobox. Use label-stacked to place the label above the combobox.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: value
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Specifies the value of an input element.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: options
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: A list of options that are available for selection. Each option has the following attributes: label and value.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: disabled
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: If present, the comboxbox is disabled and users cannot interact with it.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: read-only
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: If present, the combobox is read-only. A read-only combobox is also disabled.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: required
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: If present, a value must be selected before the form can be submitted.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: spinner-active
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: If present, a spinner is displayed below the menu items to indicate loading activity.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: validity
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Represents the validity states that an element can be in, with respect to constraint validation.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: focus
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Sets focus on the combobox.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: blur
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Removes focus from the combobox.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: checkValidity
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Returns the valid attribute value (Boolean) on the ValidityState object.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: reportValidity
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Displays the error messages and returns false if the input is invalid. If the input is valid, reportValidity() clears displayed error messages and returns true.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: setCustomValidity
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.ARGUMENTS:
NAME	TYPE	DESCRIPTION
message	unknown	The string that describes the error. If message is an empty string, the error message is reset.
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Sets a custom error message to be displayed when the combobox value is submitted.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: showHelpMessageIfInvalid
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Shows the help message if the combobox is in an invalid state.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: message
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: The string that describes the error. If message is an empty string, the error message is reset.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: columns
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Array of the columns object that's used to define the data types. Required properties include 'label', 'fieldName', and 'type'. The default type is 'text'. See the Documentation tab for more information.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: data
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: The array of data to be displayed.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: key-field
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Required for better performance. Associates each row with a unique ID.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: hide-checkbox-column
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: If present, the checkbox column for row selection is hidden.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: show-row-number-column
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: If present, the row numbers are shown in the first column.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: row-number-offset
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Determines where to start counting the row number. The default is 0.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: resize-column-disabled
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: If present, column resizing is disabled.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: min-column-width
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: The minimum width for all columns. The default is 50px.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: max-column-width
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: The maximum width for all columns. The default is 1000px.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: resize-step
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: The width to resize the column when a user presses left or right arrow. The default is 10px.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: sorted-by
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: The column fieldName that controls the sorting order. Sort the data using the onsort event handler.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: sorted-direction
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Specifies the sorting direction. Sort the data using the onsort event handler. Valid options include 'asc' and 'desc'.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: default-sort-direction
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Specifies the default sorting direction on an unsorted column. Valid options include 'asc' and 'desc'. The default is 'asc' for sorting in ascending order.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: enable-infinite-loading
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: If present, you can load a subset of data and then display more when users scroll to the end of the table. Use with the onloadmore event handler to retrieve more data.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: load-more-offset
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Determines when to trigger infinite loading based on how many pixels the table's scroll position is from the bottom of the table. The default is 20.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: is-loading
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: If present, a spinner is shown to indicate that more data is loading.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: max-row-selection
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: The maximum number of rows that can be selected. Checkboxes are used for selection by default, and radio buttons are used when maxRowSelection is 1.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: selected-rows
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Enables programmatic row selection with a list of key-field values.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: errors
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Specifies an object containing information about cell level, row level, and table level errors. When it's set, error messages are displayed on the table accordingly.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: draft-values
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: The current values per row that are provided during inline edit.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: hide-table-header
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: If present, the table header is hidden.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: suppress-bottom-bar
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: If present, the footer that displays the Save and Cancel buttons is hidden during inline editing.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: getSelectedRows
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Returns data in each selected row.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: source-label
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Label for the source options listbox.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: selected-label
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Label for the selected options listbox.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: label
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Label for the dual listbox.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: options
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: A list of options that are available for selection. Each option has the following attributes: label and value.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: min
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Minimum number of options required in the selected options listbox.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: max
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Maximum number of options allowed in the selected options listbox.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: name
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Specifies the name of an input element.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: message-when-value-missing
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Error message to be displayed when the value is missing and input is required.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: message-when-range-overflow
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Error message to be displayed when a range overflow is detected.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: message-when-range-underflow
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Error message to be displayed when a range underflow is detected.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: disabled
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: If present, the listbox is disabled and users cannot interact with it.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: required
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: If present, the user must add an item to the selected listbox before submitting the form.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: value
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: A list of default options that are included in the selected options listbox. This list is populated with values from the options attribute.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: required-options
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: A list of required options that cannot be removed from selected options listbox. This list is populated with values from the options attribute.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: variant
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: The variant changes the appearance of the dual listbox. Accepted variants include standard, label-hidden, label-inline, and label-stacked. This value defaults to standard. Use label-hidden to hide the label but make it available to assistive technology. Use label-inline to horizontally align the label and dual listbox. Use label-stacked to place the label above the dual listbox.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: size
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Number of items that display in the listboxes before vertical scrollbars are displayed. Determines the vertical size of the listbox.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: field-level-help
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Help text detailing the purpose and function of the dual listbox.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: disable-reordering
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: If present, the Up and Down buttons used for reordering the selected list items are hidden.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: show-activity-indicator
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: If present, a spinner is displayed in the first listbox to indicate loading activity.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: validity
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Represents the validity states that an element can be in, with respect to constraint validation.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: add-button-label
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Label for add button.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: remove-button-label
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Label for remove button.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: up-button-label
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Label for up button.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: down-button-label
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Label for down button.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: focus
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Sets focus on the first option from either list. If the source list doesn't contain any options, the first option on the selected list is focused on.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: checkValidity
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Returns the valid attribute value (Boolean) on the ValidityState object.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: reportValidity
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Displays the error messages and returns false if the input is invalid. If the input is valid, reportValidity() clears displayed error messages and returns true.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: setCustomValidity
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.ARGUMENTS:
NAME	TYPE	DESCRIPTION
message	unknown	The string that describes the error. If message is an empty string, the error message is reset.
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Sets a custom error message to be displayed when the dual listbox value is submitted.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: showHelpMessageIfInvalid
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Displays an error message if the dual listbox value is required.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: message
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: The string that describes the error. If message is an empty string, the error message is reset.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: alternative-text
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: The alternative text used to describe the dynamic icon. This text should describe what's happening. For example, 'Graph is refreshing', not what the icon looks like, 'Graph'.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: type
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: The Lightning Design System name of the dynamic icon. Valid values are: ellie, eq, score, strength, trend, and waffle.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: option
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: The option attribute changes the appearance of the dynamic icon. The options available depend on the type. eq: play (default) or stop score: positive (default) or negative strength: -3, -2, -1, 0 (default), 1, 2, 3 trend: neutral (default), up, or down

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: name
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Specifies the name of the input element.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: label
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: The text label for the file uploader.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: accept
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Comma-separated list of file extensions that can be uploaded in the format .ext, such as .pdf, .jpg, or .png.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: record-id
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: The record Id of the record that the uploaded file is associated to.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: disabled
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Specifies whether this component should be displayed in a disabled state. Disabled components can't be clicked. The default is false.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: multiple
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Specifies whether a user can upload more than one file simultanesouly. The default is false.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: street
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: The street detail for the address.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: city
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: The city detail for the address.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: province
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: The province detail for the address.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: country
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: The country detail for the address.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: postal-code
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: The postal code detail for the address.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: latitude
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: The latitude of the location if known. Latitude values must be within -90 and 90.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: longitude
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: The longitude of the location if known. Longitude values must be within -180 and 180.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: disabled
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: If present, the address is displayed as plain text and is not clickable.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: show-static-map
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Displays a static map of the location using Google Maps. This value defaults to false.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: value
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: The value to be formatted, which can be a Date object, timestamp, or an ISO8601 formatted string.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: weekday
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Specifies how to display the day of the week. Allowed values are narrow, short, or long.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: era
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Allowed values are narrow, short, or long.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: year
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Allowed values are numeric or 2-digit.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: month
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Allowed values are 2-digit, narrow, short, or long.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: day
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Allowed values are numeric or 2-digit.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: hour
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Allowed values are numeric or 2-digit.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: minute
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Allowed values are numeric or 2-digit.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: second
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Allowed values are numeric or 2-digit.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: time-zone-name
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Allowed values are short or long. For example, the Pacific time zone would display as 'PST' if you specify 'short', or 'Pacific Standard Time' if you specify 'long.'

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: time-zone
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: The time zone to display. Use this attribute only if you want to override the default, which is the runtime's time zone. Specify a time zone listed in the IANA time zone database (https://www.iana.org/time-zones). For example, set the value to 'Pacific/Honolulu' to display Hawaii time. The short code UTC is also accepted.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: hour12
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Determines whether time is displayed as 12-hour. If false, time displays as 24-hour. The default setting is determined by the user's locale.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: value
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: The email address that's displayed if a label is not provided.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: label
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: The text label for the email address.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: tab-index
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Reserved for internal use. Use tabindex instead to indicate if an element should be focusable. A value of 0 means that the element is focusable and participates in sequential keyboard navigation. A value of -1 means that the element is focusable but does not participate in keyboard navigation.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: hide-icon
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: If present, the email icon is hidden and only the email address is displayed.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: focus
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Sets focus on the element.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: blur
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Removes keyboard focus from the element.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: click
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Clicks the email address and opens the default email app.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: latitude
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: The latitude of the geolocation. Latitude values must be within -90 and 90.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: longitude
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: The longitude of the geolocation. Longitude values must be within -180 and 180.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: format
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: The format to use to display the name. Valid values include short, medium, and long. This value defaults to long.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: salutation
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: The value for the salutation, such as Dr. or Mrs.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: first-name
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: The value for the first name.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: last-name
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: The value for the last name.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: middle-name
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: The value for the middle name.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: suffix
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: The value for the suffix, such as Jr. or Esq.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: informal-name
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: The value for the informal name.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: value
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: The value to be formatted.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: format-style
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: The number formatting style to use. Possible values are decimal, currency, and percent. This value defaults to decimal.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: currency-code
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Only used if format-style='currency', this attribute determines which currency is displayed. Possible values are the ISO 4217 currency codes, such as 'USD' for the US dollar.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: currency-display-as
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Determines how currency is displayed. Possible values are symbol, code, and name. This value defaults to symbol.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: minimum-integer-digits
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: The minimum number of integer digits that are required. Possible values are from 1 to 21.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: minimum-fraction-digits
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: The minimum number of fraction digits that are required.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: maximum-fraction-digits
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: The maximum number of fraction digits that are allowed.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: minimum-significant-digits
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: The minimum number of significant digits that are required. Possible values are from 1 to 21.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: maximum-significant-digits
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: The maximum number of significant digits that are allowed. Possible values are from 1 to 21.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: value
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Sets the phone number to display.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: tab-index
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Reserved for internal use. Use tabindex instead to indicate if an element should be focusable. A value of 0 means that the element is focusable and participates in sequential keyboard navigation. A value of -1 means that the element is focusable but does not participate in keyboard navigation.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: focus
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Sets focus on the element.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: blur
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Removes keyboard focus from the element.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: click
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Clicks the phone number and opens the default phone app.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: disable-linkify
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: If present, the component does not create links in the rich text.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: value
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Sets the rich text to display.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: value
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Sets the text to display.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: linkify
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: If present, URLs and email addresses are displayed in anchor tags. They are displayed in plain text by default.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: value
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Time value to format.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: target
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Specifies where to open the link. Options include _blank, _parent, _self, and _top.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: tooltip
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: The text to display when the mouse hovers over the link.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: label
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: The text to display in the link.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: tab-index
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Reserved for internal use. Use tabindex instead to indicate if an element should be focusable. A value of 0 means that the element is focusable and participates in sequential keyboard navigation. A value of -1 means that the element is focusable but does not participate in keyboard navigation.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: value
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: The URL to format.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: focus
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Sets focus on the element.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: blur
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Removes keyboard focus from the element.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: content
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Text to be shown in the popover.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: icon-name
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: The Lightning Design System name of the icon used as the visible element. Names are written in the format 'utility:info' where 'utility' is the category, and 'info' is the specific icon to be displayed. The default is 'utility:info'.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: icon-variant
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Changes the appearance of the icon. Accepted variants include inverse, warning, error.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: alternative-text
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: The alternative text used to describe the icon. This text should describe what happens when you click the button, for example 'Upload File', not what the icon looks like, 'Paperclip'.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: src
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: A uri path to a custom svg sprite, including the name of the resouce, for example: /assets/icons/standard-sprite/svg/test.svg#icon-heart

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: icon-name
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: The Lightning Design System name of the icon. Names are written in the format 'utility:down' where 'utility' is the category, and 'down' is the specific icon to be displayed.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: size
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: The size of the icon. Options include xx-small, x-small, small, medium, or large. The default is medium.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: variant
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: The variant changes the appearance of a utility icon. Accepted variants include inverse, success, warning, and error. Use the inverse variant to implement a white fill in utility icons on dark backgrounds.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: placeholder
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Text that is displayed when the field is empty, to prompt the user for a valid entry.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: name
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Specifies the name of an input element.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: label
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Text label for the input.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: message-when-bad-input
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Error message to be displayed when a bad input is detected.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: message-when-pattern-mismatch
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Error message to be displayed when a pattern mismatch is detected.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: message-when-range-overflow
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Error message to be displayed when a range overflow is detected.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: message-when-range-underflow
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Error message to be displayed when a range underflow is detected.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: message-when-step-mismatch
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Error message to be displayed when a step mismatch is detected.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: message-when-too-short
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Error message to be displayed when the value is too short.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: message-when-too-long
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Error message to be displayed when the value is too long.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: message-when-type-mismatch
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Error message to be displayed when a type mismatch is detected.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: message-when-value-missing
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Error message to be displayed when the value is missing.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: message-toggle-active
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Text shown for the active state of a toggle. The default is "Active".

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: message-toggle-inactive
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Text shown for the inactive state of a toggle. The default is "Inactive".

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: aria-label
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Describes the input to assistive technologies.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: autocomplete
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Controls auto-filling of the field. Use this attribute with email, search, tel, text, and url input types only. Set the attribute to pass through autocomplete values to be interpreted by the browser.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: format-fraction-digits
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Reserved for internal use.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: time-aria-controls
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: A space-separated list of element IDs whose presence or content is controlled by the time input when type='datetime'. On mobile devices, this is merged with aria-controls and date-aria-controls to describe the native date time input.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: date-style
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: The display style of the date when type='date' or type='datetime'. Valid values are short, medium (default), and long. The format of each style is specific to the locale. On mobile devices this attribute has no effect.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: time-style
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: The display style of the time when type='time' or type='datetime'. Valid values are short (default), medium, and long. Currently, medium and long styles look the same. On mobile devices this attribute has no effect.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: date-aria-label
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Describes the date input to assistive technologies when type='datetime'. On mobile devices, this label is merged with aria-label and time-aria-label to describe the native date time input.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: date-aria-labelled-by
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: A space-separated list of element IDs that provide labels for the date input when type='datetime'. On mobile devices, this is merged with aria-labelled-by and time-aria-labelled-by to describe the native date time input.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: time-aria-labelled-by
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: A space-separated list of element IDs that provide labels for the time input when type='datetime'. On mobile devices, this is merged with aria-labelled-by and date-aria-labelled-by to describe the native date time input.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: time-aria-described-by
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: A space-separated list of element IDs that provide descriptive labels for the time input when type='datetime'. On mobile devices, this is merged with aria-described-by and date-aria-described-by to describe the native date time input.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: date-aria-controls
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: A space-separated list of element IDs whose presence or content is controlled by the date input when type='datetime'. On mobile devices, this is merged with aria-controls and time-aria-controls to describe the native date time input.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: date-aria-described-by
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: A space-separated list of element IDs that provide descriptive labels for the date input when type='datetime'. On mobile devices, this is merged with aria-described-by and time-aria-described-by to describe the native date time input.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: aria-controls
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: A space-separated list of element IDs whose presence or content is controlled by the input.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: aria-labelled-by
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: A space-separated list of element IDs that provide labels for the input.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: aria-described-by
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: A space-separated list of element IDs that provide descriptive labels for the input.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: formatter
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: String value with the formatter to be used for number input. Valid values include decimal, percent, percent-fixed, and currency.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: type
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: The type of the input. This value defaults to text.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: is-loading
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: For the search type only. If present, a spinner is displayed to indicate that data is loading.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: pattern
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Specifies the regular expression that the input's value is checked against. This attribute is supported for email, password, search, tel, text, and url types.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: max-length
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: The maximum number of characters allowed in the field. Use this attribute with email, password, search, tel, text, and url input types only.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: accept
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Specifies the types of files that the server accepts. Use this attribute with file input type only.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: min-length
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: The minimum number of characters allowed in the field. Use this attribute with email, password, search, tel, text, and url input types only.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: max
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: The maximum acceptable value for the input. Use this attribute with number, range, date, time, and datetime input types only. For number and range type, the max value is a decimal number. For the date, time, and datetime types, the max value must use a valid string for the type.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: min
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: The minimum acceptable value for the input. Use this attribute with number, range, date, time, and datetime input types only. For number and range types, the min value is a decimal number. For the date, time, and datetime types, the min value must use a valid string for the type.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: step
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Granularity of the value, specified as a positive floating point number. Use this attribute with number and range input types only. Use 'any' when granularity is not a concern. This value defaults to 1.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: checked
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: If present, the checkbox is selected.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: multiple
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Specifies that a user can enter more than one value. Use this attribute with file and email input types only.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: value
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Specifies the value of an input element.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: variant
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: The variant changes the appearance of an input field. Accepted variants include standard, label-inline, label-hidden, and label-stacked. This value defaults to standard, which displays the label above the field. Use label-hidden to hide the label but make it available to assistive technology. Use label-inline to horizontally align the label and input field. Use label-stacked to place the label above the input field.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: disabled
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: If present, the input field is disabled and users cannot interact with it.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: read-only
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: If present, the input field is read-only and cannot be edited by users.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: required
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: If present, the input field must be filled out before the form is submitted.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: timezone
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Specifies the time zone used when type='datetime' only. This value defaults to the user's Salesforce time zone setting.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: files
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: A FileList that contains selected files. Use this attribute with the file input type only.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: validity
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Represents the validity states that an element can be in, with respect to constraint validation.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: field-level-help
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Help text detailing the purpose and function of the input. This attribute isn't supported for file, radio, toggle, and checkbox-button types.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: access-key
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Specifies a shortcut key to activate or focus an element.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: checkValidity
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Checks if the input is valid.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: setCustomValidity
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.ARGUMENTS:
NAME	TYPE	DESCRIPTION
message	unknown	The string that describes the error. If message is an empty string, the error message is reset.
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Sets a custom error message to be displayed when a form is submitted.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: reportValidity
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Displays the error messages and returns false if the input is invalid. If the input is valid, reportValidity() clears displayed error messages and returns true.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: focus
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Sets focus on the input element.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: blur
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Removes keyboard focus from the input element.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: showHelpMessageIfInvalid
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Displays error messages on invalid fields. An invalid field fails at least one constraint validation and returns false when checkValidity() is called.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: message
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: The string that describes the error. If message is an empty string, the error message is reset.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: address-label
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: The label of the address compound field.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: street-label
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: The label of the street field of the address.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: city-label
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: The label of the city field of the address.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: province-label
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: The label of the province field of the address.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: country-label
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: The label of the country field of the address.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: postal-code-label
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: The label of the postal code field of the address.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: province-options
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: The array of label-value pairs for the province. Displays a dropdown menu of options.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: country-options
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: The array of label-value pairs for the country. Displays a dropdown menu of options.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: street
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: The street field of the address.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: city
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: The city field of the address.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: province
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: The province field of the address. If province-options is provided, this province value is selected by default.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: country
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: The country field of the address. If country-options is provided, this country value is selected by default.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: postal-code
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: The postal code field of the address.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: disabled
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: If present, the address fields are disabled and users cannot interact with them.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: show-address-lookup
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: If present, address lookup using Google Maps is enabled.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: read-only
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: If present, the address fields are read-only and cannot be edited.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: required
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: If present, the address fields must be filled before the form is submitted.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: variant
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: The variant changes the appearance of an input address field. Accepted variants include standard, label-hidden, label-inline, and label-stacked. This value defaults to standard. Use label-hidden to hide the label but make it available to assistive technology. Use label-inline to horizontally align the label and input address field. Use label-stacked to place the label above the input address field.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: field-level-help
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Help text detailing the purpose and function of the input.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: validity
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Represents the validity states that an element can be in, with respect to constraint validation.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: checkValidity
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Checks if the input is valid.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: showHelpMessageIfInvalid
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Displays error messages on the address fields if the values are invalid.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: setCustomValidityForField
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.ARGUMENTS:
NAME	TYPE	DESCRIPTION
message	unknown	The string that describes the error. If message is an empty string, the error message is reset.
fieldName	unknown	Name of the field, which must be one of the following: street, city, province, postalCode, country.
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Sets a custom error message to be displayed for the specified fieldName when the input address value is submitted.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: reportValidity
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Displays the error messages and returns false if the input is invalid. If the input is valid, reportValidity() clears displayed error messages and returns true.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: focus
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Sets focus on the first input element.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: blur
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Removes focus from all input fields.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: message
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: The string that describes the error. If message is an empty string, the error message is reset.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: fieldName
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Name of the field, which must be one of the following: street, city, province, postalCode, country.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: readonly
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Specifies whether the input fields are read-only. This value defaults to false.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: variant
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: The variant changes the label position of an input field. Accepted variants include standard, label-hidden, label-inline, and label-stacked. If variant is specified, the label position is determined by the variant. Otherwise, it is determined by the density setting of the parent form.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: value
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: The field value, which overrides the existing value.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: field-name
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: The API name of the field to be displayed.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: disabled
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: If present, the field is disabled and users cannot interact with it. Read-only fields are also disabled by default.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: dirty
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Reserved for internal use. If present, the field has been modified by the user but not saved or submitted.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Resets the form fields to their initial values.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: label
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: The label of the geolocation compound field.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: field-level-help
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Help text detailing the purpose and function of the input.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: latitude
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: The latitude value. Latitude values must be within -90 and 90.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: longitude
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: The longitude value. Longitude values must be within -180 and 180.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: disabled
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: If present, the geolocation fields are disabled and users cannot interact with them.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: read-only
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: If present, the geolocations fields are read-only and cannot be edited.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: required
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: If present, the geolocation fields must be filled out before the form is submitted. An error message is displayed if a user interacts with the field and does not provide a value.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: variant
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: The variant changes the appearance of a geolocation compound field. Accepted variants include standard, label-hidden, label-inline, and label-stacked. This value defaults to standard. Use label-hidden to hide the label but make it available to assistive technology. Use label-inline to horizontally align the label and geolocation fields. Use label-stacked to place the label above the geolocation fields.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: validity
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Represents the validity states that an element can be in, with respect to constraint validation.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: focus
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Sets focus on the latitude field.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: blur
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Removes keyboard focus from the latitude and longitude fields.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: checkValidity
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Returns the valid attribute value (Boolean) on the ValidityState object.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: showHelpMessageIfInvalid
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Displays error messages on the latitude or longitude field if the coordinates are invalid.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: setCustomValidityForField
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.ARGUMENTS:
NAME	TYPE	DESCRIPTION
message	unknown	The string that describes the error. If message is an empty string, the error message is reset.
fieldName	unknown	Name of the field, which must be latitude or longitude.
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Sets a custom error message to be displayed for the latitude or longitude field when the value is submitted.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: reportValidity
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Displays the error messages and returns false if the input is invalid. If the input is valid, reportValidity() clears displayed error messages and returns true.
