https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: The string that describes the error. If message is an empty string, the error message is reset.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: fieldName
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Name of the field, which must be latitude or longitude.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: label
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: The label of the input name field.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: options
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Displays a list of salutation options, such as Dr. or Mrs., provided as label-value pairs.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: fields-to-display
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: List of fields to be displayed on the component. This value defaults to ['firstName', 'salutation', 'lastName']. Other field values include middleName, informalName, suffix.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: salutation
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Displays the Salutation field as a dropdown menu. An array of label-value pairs must be provided using the options attribute.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: first-name
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Displays the First Name field.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: middle-name
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Displays the Middle Name field.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: informal-name
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Displays the Informal Name field.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: last-name
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Displays the Last Name field.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: suffix
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Displays the Suffix field.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: disabled
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: If present, the input name field is disabled and users cannot interact with it.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: read-only
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: If present, the input name field is read-only and cannot be edited.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: required
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: If present, the input name field must be filled out before the form is submitted. A red asterisk is displayed on the Last Name field. An error message is displayed if a user interacts with the Last Name field and does not provide a value.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: variant
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: The variant changes the appearance of a name compound field. Accepted variants include standard, label-hidden, label-inline, and label-stacked. This value defaults to standard. Use label-hidden to hide the label but make it available to assistive technology. Use label-inline to horizontally align the label and name fields. Use label-stacked to place the label above the name fields.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: field-level-help
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Help text detailing the purpose and function of the input.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: validity
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Represents the validity states that an element can be in, with respect to constraint validation.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: focus
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Sets focus on the first input field.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: blur
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Removes keyboard focus from the input element.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: showHelpMessageIfInvalid
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Displays error messages on the latitude or longitude field if the coordinates are invalid.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: setCustomValidityForField
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.ARGUMENTS:
NAME	TYPE	DESCRIPTION
message	unknown	The string that describes the error. If message is an empty string, the error message is reset.
fieldName	unknown	The name of the input name field.
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Sets a custom error message to be displayed for the input name fields when the input value is submitted.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: reportValidity
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Displays the error messages and returns false if the input is invalid. If the input is valid, reportValidity() clears displayed error messages and returns true.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: message
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: The string that describes the error. If message is an empty string, the error message is reset.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: fieldName
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: The name of the input name field.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: label
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: The label of the rich text editor.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: label-visible
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: If present, the label on the rich text editor is visible.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: placeholder
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Text that is displayed when the field is empty, to prompt the user for a valid entry.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: disabled-categories
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: A comma-separated list of button categories to remove from the toolbar.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: formats
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: A whitelist of formats. By default, the list is computed based on enabled categories. The 'table' format is always enabled to support copying and pasting of tables if formats are not provided.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: variant
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: The variant changes the appearance of the toolbar. Accepted variant is bottom-toolbar which causes the toolbar to be displayed below the text box.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: message-when-bad-input
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Error message to be displayed when invalid input is detected.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: custom-buttons
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Reserved for internal use. Custom buttons to add to the toolbar.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: share-with-entity-id
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Entity ID to share the image with.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: value
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: The HTML content in the rich text editor.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: valid
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Specifies whether the editor content is valid. If invalid, the slds-has-error class is added. This value defaults to true.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: disabled
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: If present, the editor is disabled and users cannot interact with it.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: focus
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Sets focus on the rich text editor.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: blur
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Removes focus from the rich text editor.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: setFormat
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.ARGUMENTS:
NAME	TYPE	DESCRIPTION
formats	unknown	A key-value pair with format names and values.
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Sets a format in the editor from the cursor point onwards. The format also applies to currently selected content. Valid formats are font, size, and align.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: getFormat
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Returns an object representing the formats applied to the current selection. Only align, font, and size are supported.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: insertTextAtCursor
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.ARGUMENTS:
NAME	TYPE	DESCRIPTION
text	unknown	text to insert
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Reserved for internal use. Insert text in the rich text editor at cursor position.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: formats
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: A key-value pair with format names and values.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: text
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: text to insert

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: horizontal-align
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Determines how to spread the layout items horizontally. The alignment options are center, space, spread, and end.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: vertical-align
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Determines how to align the layout items vertically in the container. The alignment options are start, center, end, and stretch.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: pull-to-boundary
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Pulls layout items to the layout boundaries and corresponds to the padding size on the layout item. Possible values are small, medium, or large.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: multiple-rows
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: If present, layout items wrap to the following line when they exceed the layout width.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: flexibility
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Make the item fluid so that it absorbs any extra space in its container or shrinks when there is less space. Allowed values are: auto (columns grow or shrink equally as space allows), shrink (columns shrink equally as space decreases), no-shrink (columns don't shrink as space reduces), grow (columns grow equally as space increases), no-grow (columns don't grow as space increases), no-flex (columns don't grow or shrink as space changes). Use a comma-separated value for multiple options, such as 'auto, no-shrink'.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: alignment-bump
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Specifies a direction to bump the alignment of adjacent layout items. Allowed values are left, top, right, bottom.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: padding
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Sets padding to either the right and left sides of a container, or all sides of a container. Allowed values are horizontal-small, horizontal-medium, horizontal-large, around-small, around-medium, around-large.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: size
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: If the viewport is divided into 12 parts, size indicates the relative space the container occupies. Size is expressed as an integer from 1 through 12. This applies for all device-types.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: small-device-size
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: If the viewport is divided into 12 parts, this attribute indicates the relative space the container occupies on device-types larger than mobile. It is expressed as an integer from 1 through 12.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: medium-device-size
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: If the viewport is divided into 12 parts, this attribute indicates the relative space the container occupies on device-types larger than tablet. It is expressed as an integer from 1 through 12.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: large-device-size
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: If the viewport is divided into 12 parts, this attribute indicates the relative space the container occupies on device-types larger than desktop. It is expressed as an integer from 1 through 12.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: default
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Placeholder for your content in lightning-layout-item.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: show-footer
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: If present, the footer element is displayed below the map. The footer shows an 'Open in Google Maps' link that opens an external window to display the selected marker location in Google Maps. Default value is false.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: list-view
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Displays or hides the list of locations. Valid values are visible, hidden, or auto. This value defaults to auto, which shows the list only when multiple markers are present. Passing in an invalid value hides the list view.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: zoom-level
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: The zoom levels as defined by Google Maps API. If a zoom level is not specified, a default zoom level is applied to accommodate all markers on the map.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: center
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: A location to use as the map's center. If center is not specified, the map centers automatically.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: markers-title
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Provides the heading title for the markers. Required if specifying multiple markers. The title is displayed below the map as a header for the list of clickable addresses.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: map-markers
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: One or more objects with the address or latitude and longitude to be displayed on the map. If latitude and longitude are provided, the address is ignored.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: value
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: A value associated with the menu item.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: label
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Text of the menu item.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: icon-name
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: The name of an icon to display after the text of the menu item.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: prefix-icon-name
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: The name of an icon to display before the text of the menu item.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: href
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: URL for a link to use for the menu item.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: draft-alternative-text
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Describes the reason for showing the draft indicator. This is required when is-draft is present on the lightning-menu-item tag.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: is-draft
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: If present, a draft indicator is shown on the menu item. A draft indicator is denoted by blue asterisk on the left of the menu item. When you use a draft indicator, include alternative text for accessibility using draft-alternative-text.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: access-key
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: The keyboard shortcut for the menu item.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: tab-index
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Reserved for internal use. Use tabindex instead to indicate if an element should be focusable. tabindex can be set to 0 or -1. The default tabindex value is 0, which means that the menu item is focusable and participates in sequential keyboard navigation. The value -1 means that the menu item is focusable but does not participate in keyboard navigation.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: disabled
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: If present, the menu item is disabled and users cannot interact with it.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: checked
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: If present, a check mark displays on the left of the menu item if it's selected.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: focus
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Sets focus on the anchor element in the menu item.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: field-class
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: A CSS class for the outer element, in addition to the component's base classes.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: variant
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Changes the appearance of the output. Accepted variants include standard and label-hidden. This value defaults to standard.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: field-name
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: The API name of the field to be displayed.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: wireRecordUi
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.ARGUMENTS:
NAME	TYPE	DESCRIPTION
data	unknown	The record and objectInfo data
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Reserved for internal use.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: data
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: The record and objectInfo data

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: href
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: The URL of the page that the link goes to.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: label
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: The text label that displays in the pill.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: name
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: The name for the pill. This value is optional and can be used to identify the pill in a callback.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: variant
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: The variant changes the appearance of the pill. Accepted variants include link, plain, and plainLink. The default variant is link, which creates a link in the pill when you specify the href attribute. The plain variant renders the pill without a link and ignores the href attribute. The plainLink variant is reserved for internal use.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: has-error
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: If present, the pill is shown with a red border and an error icon on the left of the label.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: is-plain-link
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Reserved for internal use. Specifies whether the element variant is a plain link.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: tab-index
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Reserved for internal use. Use tabindex instead to indicate if an element should be focusable. A value of 0 means that the pill is focusable and participates in sequential keyboard navigation. A value of -1 means that the pill is focusable but does not participate in keyboard navigation.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: aria-selected
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Specifies the aria-selected of an element.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: role
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Specifies the role of an element.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: focusLink
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Reserved for internal use. Sets focus on the anchor element for a plain link.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: default
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Placeholder for an image, such as an icon or avatar.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: label
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Aria label for the pill container.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: variant
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: The variant changes the appearance of the pill container. Accepted variants include standard and bare. This value defaults to standard.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: single-line
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Specifies whether to keep the pills in a single line.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: is-collapsible
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Specifies whether the pill container can be collapsed.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: is-expanded
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Specifies whether the pill container is expanded.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: items
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: An array of items to be rendered as pills in a container.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: focus
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Sets focus on the pill list.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: value
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: The percentage value of the progress bar.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: variant
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: The variant changes the appearance of the progress bar. Accepted variants include base or circular. This value defaults to base.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: size
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: The size of the progress bar. Valid values are x-small, small, medium, and large. The default value is medium.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: type
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Changes the visual pattern of the indicator. Valid values are base and path. The default is base.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: variant
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Changes the appearance of the progress indicator for the base type only. Valid values are base or shaded. The shaded variant adds a light gray border to the step indicators. The default is base.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: current-step
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Set current-step to match the value attribute of one of progress-step components. If current-step is not provided, the value of the first progress-step component is used.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: has-error
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: If present, the current step is in error state and a warning icon is displayed on the step indicator. Only the base type can display errors.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: default
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Placeholder for lightning-progress-step.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: type
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: The style of the radio group. Options are radio or button. The default is radio.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: label
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Text label for the radio group.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: options
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Array of label-value pairs for each radio button.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: message-when-value-missing
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Optional message displayed when no radio button is selected and the required attribute is set to true.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: name
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Specifies the name of the radio button group. Only only one button can be selected if a name is specified for the group.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: value
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Specifies the value of the selected radio button.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: disabled
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: If present, the radio group is disabled and users cannot interact with it.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: required
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: If present, a radio button must be selected before the form can be submitted.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: variant
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: The variant changes the appearance of the radio group. Accepted variants include standard, label-hidden, label-inline, and label-stacked. This value defaults to standard. Use label-hidden to hide the label but make it available to assistive technology. Use label-inline to horizontally align the label and radio group. Use label-stacked to place the label above the radio group.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: validity
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Represents the validity states that an element can be in, with respect to constraint validation.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: checkValidity
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Returns the valid attribute value (Boolean) on the ValidityState object.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: reportValidity
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Displays the error messages and returns false if the input is invalid. If the input is valid, reportValidity() clears displayed error messages and returns true.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: setCustomValidity
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.ARGUMENTS:
NAME	TYPE	DESCRIPTION
message	unknown	The string that describes the error. If message is an empty string, the error message is reset.
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Sets a custom error message to be displayed when the radio group value is submitted.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: showHelpMessageIfInvalid
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Shows the help message if the form control is in an invalid state.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: focus
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Sets focus on the first radio input element.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: message
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: The string that describes the error. If message is an empty string, the error message is reset.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: field-names
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Reserved for internal use. Names of the fields to include in the form.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: record-type-id
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: The ID of the record type, which is required if you created multiple record types but don't have a default.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: form-class
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: A CSS class for the form element.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: layout-type
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: The type of layout to use to display the form fields. Possible values: Compact, Full.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: density
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Sets the arrangement style of fields and labels in the form. Accepted values are compact, comfy, and auto (default). Use compact to display fields and their labels on the same line. Use comfy to display fields below their labels. Use auto to let the component dynamically set the density according to the user's Display Density setting and the width of the form.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: record-id
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: The ID of the record to be displayed.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: object-api-name
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: The API name of the object.

NAME	TYPE	DESCRIPTION
fields	unknown	Array of record field names or field IDs.
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Submits the form using an array of record fields or field IDs. The field ID is provisioned from @salesforce/schema/. Invoke this method only after the load event.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: fields
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Array of record field names or field IDs.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: default
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Placeholder for form components like lightning-messages, lightning-button, lightning-input-field and lightning-output-field. Use lightning-input-field to display an editable field.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: record-type-id
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: The ID of the record type, which is required if you created multiple record types but don't have a default.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: mode
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Specifies the interaction and display style for the form. Possible values: view, edit, readonly. If a record ID is not provided, the default mode is edit, which displays a form to create new records. If a record ID is provided, the default mode is view, which displays field values with edit icons on updateable fields.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: layout-type
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: The type of layout to use to display the form fields. Possible values: Compact, Full. When creating a new record, only the full layout is supported.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: density

Use compact to display fields and their labels on the same line. Use comfy to display fields below their labels. Use auto to let the component dynamically set the density according to the user's Display Density setting and the width of the form.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: record-id
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: The ID of the record to be displayed.

NAME	TYPE	DESCRIPTION
fields	unknown	Array of record field names or field IDs.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Array of record field names or field IDs.

Use compact to display fields and their labels on the same line. Use comfy to display fields below their labels. Use auto to let the component dynamically set the density according to the user's Display Density setting and the width of the form.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: The ID of the record to be displayed.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: The API name of the object.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: size
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: The size of the slider. The default is an empty string, which sets the slider to the width of the viewport. Accepted values are x-small, small, medium, and large.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: type
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: The type determines the orientation of the slider. Accepted values are vertical and horizontal. The default is horizontal.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: label
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Text label to describe the slider. Provide your own label to describe the slider.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: message-when-range-overflow
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Error message to be displayed when a range overflow is detected.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: message-when-range-underflow
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Error message to be displayed when a range underflow is detected.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: message-when-step-mismatch
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Error message to be displayed when a step mismatch is detected.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: message-when-value-missing
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Error message to be displayed when the value is missing.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: message-when-too-long
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Error message to be displayed when the value is too long.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: message-when-bad-input
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Error message to be displayed when a bad input is detected.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: message-when-pattern-mismatch
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Error message to be displayed when a pattern mismatch is detected.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: message-when-type-mismatch
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Error message to be displayed when a type mismatch is detected.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: min
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: The minimum value of the input range. The default is 0.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: max
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: The maximum value of the input range. The default is 100.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: step
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: The step increment value of the input range. Example steps include 0.1, 1, or 10. The default is 1.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: disabled
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: If present, the slider is disabled and users cannot interact with it.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: variant
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: The variant changes the appearance of the slider. Accepted variants include standard and label-hidden. The default is standard.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: value
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: The numerical value of the slider. The default is 0.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Represents the validity states of the slider input, with respect to constraint validation.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Sets focus on the input element.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: blur
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Removes keyboard focus from the input element.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: checkValidity
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Returns the valid attribute value (Boolean) on the ValidityState object.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: reportValidity
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Displays the error messages and returns false if the input is invalid. If the input is valid, reportValidity() clears displayed error messages and returns true.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: setCustomValidity
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.ARGUMENTS:
NAME	TYPE	DESCRIPTION
message	unknown	The string that describes the error. If message is an empty string, the error message is reset.
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Sets a custom error message to be displayed when the slider value is submitted.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: showHelpMessageIfInvalid
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Displays error messages on invalid fields. An invalid field fails at least one constraint validation and returns false when checkValidity() is called.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: message
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: The string that describes the error. If message is an empty string, the error message is reset.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: alternative-text
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: The alternative text used to describe the reason for the wait and need for a spinner.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: size
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: The size of the spinner. Accepted sizes are small, medium, and large. This value defaults to medium.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: variant
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: The variant changes the appearance of the spinner. Accepted variants include base, brand, and inverse. The default is base.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: value
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: The optional string to be used during tabset's select event to determine which tab was clicked. This string is also used by active-tab-value in tabset to open a tab.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: label
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: The text displayed in the tab header.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: title
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Specifies text that displays in a tooltip over the tab content.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: icon-name
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: The Lightning Design System name of an icon to display to the left of the tab label. Specify the name in the format 'utility:down' where 'utility' is the category, and 'down' is the icon to be displayed. Only utility icons can be used.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: icon-assistive-text
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: The alternative text for the icon specified by icon-name.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: show-error-indicator
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Specifies whether there's an error in the tab content. An error icon is displayed to the right of the tab label.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: loadContent
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Reserved for internal use.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: default
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Placeholder for your content in lightning-tab.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: title
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Displays tooltip text when the mouse moves over the tabset.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: variant
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: The variant changes the appearance of the tabset. Accepted variants are standard, scoped, and vertical.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: active-tab-value
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Sets a specific tab to open by default using a string that matches a tab's value string. If not used, the first tab opens by default.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: default
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Placeholder for lightning-tab.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Specifies the name of an input element.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Error message to be displayed when a bad input is detected.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: message-when-value-missing
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Error message to be displayed when the value is missing.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: access-key
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: The keyboard shortcut for input field.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: max-length
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: The maximum number of characters allowed in the textarea.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: value

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: disabled

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: read-only

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: required

Use label-stacked to place the label above the textarea.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: validity
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Represents the validity states of the textarea input, with respect to constraint validation.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: field-level-help
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: The help text that appears in a popover. Set field-level help to provide an informational tooltip on the textarea input field.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Displays the error messages and returns false if the input is invalid. If the input is valid, reportValidity() clears displayed error messages and returns true.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.ARGUMENTS:
NAME	TYPE	DESCRIPTION
message	unknown	The string that describes the error. If message is an empty string, the error message is reset.
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Sets a custom error message to be displayed when the textarea value is submitted.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: showHelpMessageIfInvalid
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Displays error messages on invalid fields. An invalid field fails at least one constraint validation and returns false when checkValidity() is called.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: focus
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Sets focus on the textarea field.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: blur
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Removes focus from the textarea field.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: message
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: The string that describes the error. If message is an empty string, the error message is reset.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: label
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: The text label that displays in the tile as the heading and hover text.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: href
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: The URL of the page that the link goes to.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: actions
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: A list of actions that's displayed in a dropdown menu.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: type
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: The tile type. Valid values are 'standard' and 'media'. The default is 'standard'.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: default
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Placeholder for your content that appears below the heading.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: header
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: The text that's displayed as the tree heading.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: items
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: An array of key-value pairs that describe the tree. See the Documentation tab for more information.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: hide-checkbox-column
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: If present, the checkbox column for row selection is hidden.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: is-loading
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: If present, a spinner is displayed to indicate that more data is being loaded.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: key-field
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Required for better performance. Associates each row with a unique ID.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: max-column-width
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: The maximum width for all columns. The default is 1000px.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: min-column-width
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: The minimum width for all columns. The default is 50px.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: resize-column-disabled
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: If present, column resizing is disabled.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: row-number-offset
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Determines where to start counting the row number. The default is 0.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: selected-rows
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: The array of unique row IDs that are selected.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: show-row-number-column
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: If present, the row number column are shown in the first column.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: columns
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Array of the columns object that's used to define the data types. Required properties include 'label', 'fieldName', and 'type'. The default type is 'text'. See the Documentation tab for more information.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: data
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: The array of data to be displayed.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: expanded-rows
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: The array of unique row IDs for rows that are expanded.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: getSelectedRows
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Returns data in each selected row.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: getCurrentExpandedRows
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Returns an array of rows that are expanded.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: expandAll
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Expand all rows with children content

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: collapseAll
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Collapse all rows

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: compact
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: If present, spacing between navigation items is reduced.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: shaded
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: If present, the vertical navigation is displayed on top of a shaded background.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: selected-item
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Name of the navigation item to make active. An active item is highlighted in blue.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: default
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Placeholder for lightning-vertical-navigation-section and lightning-vertical-navigation-overflow.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: label
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: The text displayed for the navigation item.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: name
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: A unique identifier for the navigation item. The name is used by the `select` event on lightning-vertical-navigation to identify which item is selected.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: href
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: The URL of the page that the navigation item goes to.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: label
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: The text displayed for this navigation item.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: name
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: A unique identifier for this navigation item.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: badge-count
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: The number to show inside the badge. If this value is zero, the badge is hidden. The default value is zero.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: assistive-text
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Assistive text describing the number in the badge, which enhances accessibility and is not displayed to the user. The default is "New Items".

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: href
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: The URL of the page that the navigation item goes to.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: label
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: The text displayed for this navigation item.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: name
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: A unique identifier for this navigation item.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: icon-name
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: The Lightning Design System name of the icon. Names are written in the format 'utility:down' where 'utility' is the category, and 'down' is the specific icon to be displayed.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: href
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: The URL of the page that the navigation item goes to.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: message-content
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: Message content based on the concrete type of the chat message.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.NAME: user-type
https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/co.DESCRIPTION: The user type, which is either "agent" or "chasitor".
